name: Ioannis Stamos
content: Ioannis Stamos' Web Page Ioannis Stamos Professor of Computer Science Hunter College and Graduate Center City University of New York Ioannis Stamos is working in the areas of Computer Vision, Computer Graphics and Robotics. His current research interests are in the broad area of 3D processing, classification and identification from range and image data. He received his Ph.D. from the Computer Science Department of Columbia University (Robotics Laboratory) on 2001, his M.S. and M.Phil. from the same department and his Diploma of Engineering from the University of Patras (Department of Computer Engineering), Greece. Ioannis Stamos is a recipient of the Faculty Early Career Development Award (CAREER) by the National Science Foundation. Area Editor, Journal of Computer Vision and Image Understanding. [Publications, Computer Vision & Robotics Laboratory, Resume, Google Scholar] Computer Vision & Robotics Lab New /  Awards Our paper on 6D category pose estimation via learning point cloud representations, has been accepted to the International Workshop on Recovering 6D Object Pose at ICCV 2025. Our paper on 6D pose estimation will be presented at IROS 2023. Area Editor  Computer Vision and Image Understanding (CVIU) Our paper on 3D object detection was presented at WACV 2020. Prior Google Research Award 2017, Geo, Classification/Segmentation of Urban Objects from 3D Point Clouds NSF MRI Award for the acquisition of mobile robots (October 2016 - October 2019) Google Research Award 2014, Geography/Maps, Car Classification in 3D Point Clouds Guest Editor for Computer Vision and Image Understanding (CVIU), Special Issue on Large-Scale 3D Modeling of Urban Indoor or Outdoor Scenes from Images and Range Scans.
